titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Stoddard Atwood Papers
titlestmt.author: Jenny Johnson

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Materials document Atwood's student experience at Stanford University between 1919 and 1923. Also included are biographical materials about Atwood.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], David Stoddard Atwood papers (SC1098). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: David Stoddard Atwood was born July 27, 1896 in Kansas City, Missouri. He earned an A.B. in Mechanical Engineering from Stanford University in 1923. While attending Stanford, Atwood participated in several dramatic theater organizations including the Sword and Sandals Society and the Masquer’s Society, and was a member of the Alpha Tau Omega fraternity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials document Atwood's student experience at Stanford University between 1919 and 1923. Items include correspondence, photographs, theater programs, items related to Alpha Tau Omega, and Senior Week and commencement related material. Also included is a biography of Atwood excerpted from a book written by Kay Atwood.

unittitle.title: Atwood, Kay. A Line of Descent: Nine Generations of Stephen Atwood (d. 1695) and Abigail Dunham Atwood of Eastham, Massachusetts.
